SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services

Class FoodStorageMenuService

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services.FoodStorageMenuService
public class FoodStorageMenuService extends Object
A service class allowing for a user interface, like TextUserInterface, to interact with a FoodStorage object.

Provides the following functionality:

  • Adding a grocery item
  • Adding a grocery batch to an existing grocery item
  • Consuming a grocery item
  • Finding a grocery item by name
  • Finding grocery items by category
  • Finding grocery items expiring on a date
  • Showing all grocery items
  • Showing all grocery items expiring before a date
  • Calculating the total value of all grocery items
  • Removing all expired grocery items
Since:
0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen
See Also:
  • TextUserInterface
  • FoodStorage

    • checkIfGroceryExists

      private boolean checkIfGroceryExists(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks if a grocery with the provided name exists in the food storage.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the grocery to check
      Returns:
      true if a grocery with the provided name exists in the food storage, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getGroceryByName

      private Grocery getGroceryByName(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets a grocery with the provided name from the food storage.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the grocery to get
      Returns:
      the grocery with the provided name, or null if no grocery with the provided name exists in the food storage
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string.

    • caseAddGrocery

      public void caseAddGrocery()
      Adds a grocery to the food storage.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the grocery. If the grocery already exists in the food storage, the method prompts the user to add a batch to the grocery instead and calls the addGroceryBatch method. If the grocery does not exist in the food storage, the method prompts the user to enter the category, unit, amount, price per unit, and expiration date of the grocery. The method then adds the grocery to the food storage.

    • addGroceryBatch

      private void addGroceryBatch(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a batch to a grocery in the food storage.

      The method prompts the user to enter the amount, price per unit, and expiration date of the batch. The method then adds the batch to the grocery in the food storage with the provided name.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the grocery to add the batch to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string, or if the grocery does not exist in the food storage.

    • caseConsumeGrocery

      public void caseConsumeGrocery()
      Consumes a grocery in the food storage.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the grocery to consume an amount of. If the grocery does not exist in the food storage, the method prints an error message and returns. If the amount to consume is equal to the total amount of the grocery, the method removes the grocery entirely from the food storage. If the amount to consume is less than the total amount of the grocery, the method calls the consume method of the grocery object to update the amount of the grocery. When the method is finished, it prints a success message.

    • caseFindGroceryByName

      public void caseFindGroceryByName()
      Finds a grocery by name in the food storage, and prints it's details to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the grocery to find. If the grocery is found, the method prints the grocery to the console. If the grocery is not found, the method prints an error message.

    • caseFindGroceriesByCategory

      public void caseFindGroceriesByCategory()
      Finds groceries by category in the food storage, and prints them to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the category of groceries to find. If no groceries are found in the category, the method prints an error message. Otherwise, the method prints the groceries to the console.

    • caseFindGroceriesExpiringOnDate

      public void caseFindGroceriesExpiringOnDate()
      Finds groceries expiring on a given date in the food storage, and prints them to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the expiration date of the groceries to find. If no groceries are found on the given date, the method prints an error message. Otherwise, the method prints the groceries to the console.

    • caseShowAllGroceries

      public void caseShowAllGroceries()
      Shows all groceries in the food storage, and prints them to the console.

      The method prints all groceries in the food storage to the console. If there are no groceries in the food storage, the method prints an error message.

    • caseShowAllExpiredGroceries

      public void caseShowAllExpiredGroceries()
      Shows all expired groceries in the food storage, and prints them to the console.

      The method prints all expired groceries in the food storage to the console. If there are no expired groceries in the food storage, the method prints an error message.

    • caseShowGroceriesExpiringBeforeDate

      public void caseShowGroceriesExpiringBeforeDate()
      Shows groceries expiring before a given date in the food storage, and prints them to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the expiration date of the groceries to find. If no groceries are found that expire before the given date, the method prints an error message. Otherwise, the method prints the groceries to the console.

    • caseCalculateGroceriesTotalValue

      public void caseCalculateGroceriesTotalValue()
      Calculates the total value of all groceries in the food storage, and prints it to the console.

      The method calculates the total value of all groceries in the food storage by iterating through each grocery and batch in the food storage. It then adds the amount and price per unit of each batch to the total value. The method prints the total value to the console.

    • caseRemoveAllExpiredGroceries

      public void caseRemoveAllExpiredGroceries()
      Removes all expired groceries from the food storage.

      The method iterates through all expired groceries in the food storage, and their batches, and removes the batches of each grocery that have expired. If the grocery batch is expired on the current date, the method consumes the whole amount of the grocery batch. If the grocery batch is not expired, the method does not remove the grocery batch.
